page.title: 01BRIDGE OF EARN AREA
page.content: Bridge of Earn is a village of 2223 inhabitants which extends south of the lowest bridging point of the River Earn about 6kms from its confluence with the estuary of the Tay. The main A 90 T road runs through Bridge of Earn between Perth 5kms to the north and Edinburgh 50kms to the south . The village dates mainly from the end of the 18th century and is now linked with the old settlement of Kintillo where there are many new housiing estates,some still under construction. The area includes the estates of Moncreiffe still occupied by the Moncreiffe family,and Kilgraston,now a school run by the Society of the Sacred Heart. The area is one of mixed farming.
